entry.title: Nightwing & Red Hood: Snow Birds
entry.summary:
Author: Robin Spotter (robinspotter)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 144,303Chapters: 30/?Kudos: 221

Summary: ***Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings under an abundance of caution. You have been warned that everything or nothing at all that personally squicks or offends you may be in this fic!*** At the end of the Joker War, Dick Grayson regained a lifetime of memories, but the mind is a twisty place. How can he reconcile a lifetime's worth of traumas when the memories have returned in agonizing detail as if they happened yesterday? How can he go forward when he remembers everything that he had ever let himself forget?Jason Todd was a teenager when his life was stolen from him in explosive violence. He has walked a long, lonely, and bitter path home to Gotham. With a new resolve not to kill, he still hangs on the fringes of tenuous ties with the Batman family. Until Dick's spiraling descent crashes into him full throttle, forcing him to confront long denied feelings.When circumstance leads them into a marriage of convenience, will they be able to overcome together what neither could overcome alone?

entry.title: concussion confessions
entry.summary:
Author: littlewing (satorusyuji)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,771Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 78

Summary: Arkham Knight's words are clipped. “Are you saying I have cat ears?” It takes Dick’s brain a generous moment to catch up. He's all gunked up, slow to process. Definitely not firing on every cylinder. Probably not even half of them. “Yeah.” Dick narrows his eyes, gaze locked on said ears. “Don’t you?” “They’re b–” Arkham Knight snaps, then abruptly cuts himself off. Takes an audible breath even through the helmet. “No. I don't.” “You totally do,” Dick argues, tone dreamy. His eyes slide back down. He grins. “It's cute. You're a kitty cat. Big, buff, scary kitty cat.” — Dick gets a concussion mid-fight and is miraculously saved by none other than the Arkham Knight. While waiting for the cavalry, they chat. It leads to something neither of them quite expected.

entry.title: What It Sounds Like
entry.summary:
Author: UltraCaffeinatedIvy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,280Chapters: 7/13Kudos: 75

Summary: Things are mostly looking up for Jason Todd. He’s finally earned a scholarship to Gotham Academy and has a place that actually feels like home. He knows it's not some kind of cosmic reward for getting through a rough past, living through Catherine's addictions, his dad up and disappearing, or any of the other shit he's had to put up with. You get dealt your hand in life, for better or —more likley— worse, and try to make the best of it. Then Dick Grayson steps in. Or Where Pamela Isley adopts Jason Todd. Enrolls him in Gotham Academy and Jason struggles being a normal teenager, having friends and, of course, falls in love with Dick Grayson in the process. A coming of age story.

entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 191,897Chapters: 41/53Kudos: 1,490

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham. Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave. The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running. Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human. Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.summary:
Author: escyn

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,358Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 45

Summary: [Jason lets himself drink in the sight of Dick underneath him. He is beautiful like this—flushed, shaking—chest coated in a deep blue kevlar he had never seen before two weeks ago. Jason takes it in now. Reinforced at the shoulders, right where the cowl would connect. Fingerstripes are still there—but the blue bleeds into a bat splashed along his heaving pecs. Undeniably Batman. In blue. Not unlike the red sigil etched into Jason’s own chest. The cruelty inflicted on them was different. Two men grown in different worlds, yet shaped by common griefs—common ghosts—both left hollow. Aching. Needing. By the same title, the same burden—] or, Jason Todd has been Batman for a very long time—has been alone for just as long. Maybe this Dick Grayson can fix that.

entry.title: Protecting What You Don't Deserve
entry.summary:
Author: Kichi (sentanixiv)

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,164Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 98

Summary: Dick Grayson loves too freely and deeply for his own good. Wary of the heartbreak that inevitably follows, there's a guardian 'angel' that visits each new partner with a simple warning: Hurt Dick Grayson and they'll be back for you. With a shovel and a grave freshly marked.ORThe five times that Jason Todd gives the shovel talk to Dick's romantic partners, and the one time he has to give it to himself.-“Right,” she replied, disbelieving. When he made no move towards or away from her, she risked a quick glance at the shovel, an eyebrow arching up. She understood the implication there and seemed more annoyed than scared. “Really? Are we doing this again?”He’d expected that. Jason chuckled at her taunt, pushing off the wall. He pulled the cigarette from between his lips, breathing out a halo of smoke. “You got a free pass last time,” he said with a shrug. Truth, for it’d been Tarantula’s machinations that tipped Babara’s relationship with Dick over into heartbreak, saving her full blame and, as such, a grave. “You can thank Catalina Flores for that.”

entry.title: To Have and To Hold
entry.summary:
Author: Starless_Void

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,258Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 57

Summary: Jason makes his way back to Gotham about a year after his big fight with Bruce. He hunkers down in a new apartment, staying as far under the radar as possible to avoid any contact with the Bats- who would probably throw him in Arkham the first chance they got. If only that were his only problem. On top of staying out of the attention of the most paranoid people on the planet, Jason is trying to find a way to undo a stupid spell that has left him in a rather strange state. Returning to Gotham is probably up there in the stupidest decisions he's ever made, but it's his home too. As long as he lays low, doesn't rebuild his criminal empire, and keeps to himself, there shouldn't be any reason for the Bats to bother him.   Dick Grayson has lost Jason twice now. There won't be a third.
